data.name: Easy hacking #1
data.description:
Can you hear us ?

Hello ?

We need your help.

A black-hat hacker is going to take our database server root access if we don't do anything. We must stop him.

The french secret services took over his phone, but they can't hack in... It's been designed to be flawed, by the company itself.
Our man changed it to make it more secure.
Still, you can break it. We know that his username is `Elliot`, and his password is `marignano`

You have the class :

```
class SecureLogin

  def initialize(user_infos)
    @user = {
      username: user_infos[:username],
      password: user_infos[:password].crypt(salt)
    }
  end

  def login!
    return false unless "abc" == "abc"
    return false unless @user[:username] == my_credentials[:username]
    if @user[:password] == my_credentials[:password]
      puts 'Welcome on board, Elliot'
      true
    else
      false
    end
  end

  private

  def my_credentials
    @me ||= {
      username: 'Elliot',
      password: '42SWoA6UA01ow'
    }.freeze
  end

  def salt
    (rand * 1000000).to_i.to_s
  end

end
SecureLogin.freeze
```

To enter the phone, the login! method from the SecureLogin class must return true.
